page.title: 16The Glassworks
page.content: The glassworks in Tutbury were started originally by Webb Corbett.Tutbury Crystal started in 1980 when Webb Corbett closed down. most of the people who work there now were employed by Webb Corbett.Some of the other workers set up another factory in the village called Georgian Crystal.There is little difference between the old and new factories except they cannot use Webb Corbett designs. Tutbury Crystal is on a much smaller scale than the old factory.Webb Corbett employed 110 people whereas Tutbury Crystal employ just over 65.Georgian Crystal is in Silk Mill Lane where there used to be a Silk Mill.Their glass is the same as most companies except that they use lead as one of their ingredients so it is called real English glass.
